head.title: Casey and Penn State Take It Out on Louisiana Tech

hedline.hl1: Casey and Penn State Take It Out on Louisiana Tech

abstract.p: Penn State defeats Louisiana Tech, 67-7; other college football results noted (S)

block.p: Penn St. 67, La. Tech 7
Rashard Casey threw a school-record-tying five touchdown passes as Penn State took out its frustrations on Louisiana Tech with a 67-7 home victory yesterday.
Penn St. 67, La. Tech 7
Rashard Casey threw a school-record-tying five touchdown passes as Penn State took out its frustrations on Louisiana Tech with a 67-7 home victory yesterday.
Casey, benched in season-opening losses to Southern Cal and Toledo, had touchdown passes of 5 and 2 yards to Eric McCoo, 10 to Tony Stewart, 35 to Tony Johnson, and 13 to Steve Delich.
''It felt good to finally get in a rhythm,'' Casey said. ''It was a lot of relief. But there's still going to be critics, regardless.''
He almost didn't make it through the first quarter, however. Casey angered coach Joe Paterno by taking two sacks on the opening series, and fumbling once.
After the ominous start, Penn State, which had one touchdown in two games, scored four in the first quarter.
Cincinnati 12 Syracuse 10
Jason Mammarelli kicked a 47-yard field on the final play of the game to lift host Cincinnati.

Jonathan Ruffin had three fourth-quarter field goals before giving way to the strong-legged Mammarelli for the winning kick. Mike Shafer had kicked a 35-yard field goal with 43 seconds left to give Syracuse (1-1) a 10-9 lead.
Ruffin's field goals of 28, 42 and 32 yards put Cincinnati (2-0) ahead for the first time, the last of the three coming with 4 minutes 37 seconds to play.
Syracuse then put together a 12-play drive leading to Shafer's field goal and the short-lived lead.
Fordham 34, Fairfield 7
The freshman Mike Mucci passed for one touchdown and rushed for another as host Fordham ended the longest losing streak in Division I-AA at 12 games.
Fordham lost all 11 games last year and its season opener last Saturday to Towson.
Mucci making his debut, was 12 of 21 for 207 yards with 4 interceptions.
St. John's 23 St. Francis 0
Josh Krapf passed for one touchdown and ran for another as St. John's beat visiting St. Francis (Pa.) in the season opener for both teams.
The Red Storm, making their Northeast Conference debut, held St. Francis to 72 yards of total offense. St. John's ranked first in Division I-AA in total defense last season.
Connecticut 37 Colgate 7
Ryan Tracey threw for 327 yards and 2 touchdowns for Division I newcomer UConn.

Tracey, a junior college transfer from California, completed 25 of 35 passes in his second solid start for the Huskies (1-1). His 340-yard performance in last week's loss to Eastern Michigan was the most ever by a UConn quarterback in his first game.
IN OTHER GAMES

Brian Westbrook broke VILLANOVA's career scoring record and scored a career-high four touchdowns to reach 262 points and lead the Wildcats over visiting MILLERSVILLE, 51-14. . . . Aaron Smith threw a 31-yard touchdown pass to Chuck Kingsley with 31 seconds left in the first half as host WAGNER beat MONMOUTH, 14-7.
COLLEGE FOOTBALL
